top_categories.workout_context: 65ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Sunday Creek Classic, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Sunday Creek Classic. Train it until it feels boring.
Sunday Creek Classic's Gravel roads, Hinterland terrain forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
Varied gradients on hinterland gravel roads demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Sunday Creek Classic's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
62 miles on hinterland gravel roads burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
When someone attacks on hinterland gravel roads, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Sunday Creek Classic, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Low-cadence force work for 4,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Base fitness for Sunday Creek Classic. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Sunday Creek Classic’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Sunday Creek Classic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on hinterland gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, hinterland terrain, dairy country.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and G Spot to prepare you for 62 miles of hinterland gravel roads in Kenilworth, Queensland.
